question_stem:
A study at the Harvard School of Public Health found that 44% of 10,000 sampled college students were binge drinkers. A student at the University of Minnesota plans to estimate the proportion of college students at her school who are binge drinkers.
How large a random sample would she need to estimate it to within 0.05 (the width is 0.1) with 95% confidence, if before conducting the study, she uses the Harvard study results as a guideline?
